question.title: Why does the compareTo method throw an exception?
question.body:
// File: Employee.java

public class Employee implements Comparable {
    public Integer salary;
    public int compareTo(Object e) {
        Employee other = (Employee) e;
        return Integer.compare(salary, other.salary);
    }
}

// File: Manager.java
public class Manager extends Employee {
    public Integer salary;
}

// File: Main.java, Contains the main method
public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Manager m = new Manager();
        Employee e_ = new Employee();

        m.salary = 0;
        e_.salary = 1;

        System.out.println(e_.compareTo(m));
        // System.out.println(e.compareTo(m));
    }
}

Can anyone explain to me why I am getting this error? I have initialised m.salary = 0 and e_.salary = 1 after creating objects of the Manager and Employee classes, which should set the instance fields in each Manager and Employee object to 0 and 1, respectively.
